Body: I know similar question is floating on the same site, but no solution works for me.I have been using Karbonn A26 Smart phone for the last two years, and I was not able to install run YouTube and Google+ since 2 years. Its hardware is quite ok. It runs Android 4.1.1.Let me be clear what I am doing:When I install and open YouTube, it says YouTube cannot work without Google Play Services. When I click on Get Play Services, it gives me error: "Incompatible with other applications(s) using the same shared user ID".So I factory reset the phone. Then I try it out, same. I can download and install YouTube, but when open it, it keeps saying same "Cannot play without Play Services".Same thing happens when I install and run Google+.Installing YouTube on clean OS itself does not work.Do I need to wipe cache? I think factory resetting must also wipe cache. What should I do to resolve this issue?
Title: "Incompatible with other applications(s) using the same shared user ID” while installing Google Play service?

history.Text: I know similar question is floating on the same site, but I am really screwed and no solution worls for me.I have Karbonn A26 Smart phone for 2 years and I was not able to install run YouTube and Google+ since 2 years. Its hardware is quite ok but I think Karbonn developers have screwed the stock OS itself. It runs Android 4.1.1.Let me be clear what I am doing: 1. When I install and open YouTube, it says YouTube cannot work without Google Play Services. When I click on **Get Play Services**, it gives me error **Incompatible with other applications(s) using the same shared user ID** 2. So I factory reset the phone. Then I try it out, same. Can download and install YouTube, but when open it, it keeps saying same "Cannot play without PLay Services". 3. Same when I install and run Google+I am screwed when installing YouTube on clean OS itself does not work.Do I need to wipe cache? I think factory resetting must also wipe cache.
"Incompatible with other applications(s) using the same shared user ID” while installing Google Play service?

I know similar question is floating on the same site, but I am really screwed and no solution worls for me.I have Karbonn A26 Smart phone for 2 years and I was not able to install run YouTube and Google+ since 2 years. Its hardware is quite ok but I think Karbonn developers have screwed the stock OS itself. It runs Android 4.1.1.Let me be clear what I am doing: 1. When I install and open YouTube, it says YouTube cannot work without Google Play Services. When I click on **Get Play Services**, it gives me error **Incompatible with other applications(s) using the same shared user ID** 2. So I factory reset the phone. Then I try it out, same. Can download and install YouTube, but when open it, it keeps saying same "Cannot play without PLay Services". 3. Same when I install and run Google+I am screwed when installing YouTube on clean OS itself does not work.Do I need to wipe cache? I think factory resetting must also wipe cache. What should I conclude about this phone?

I know similar question is floating on the same site, but no solution works for me.I have been using Karbonn A26 Smart phone for the last two years, and I was not able to install run YouTube and Google+ since 2 years. Its hardware is quite ok. It runs Android 4.1.1.Let me be clear what I am doing: 1. When I install and open YouTube, it says YouTube cannot work without Google Play Services. When I click on **Get Play Services**, it gives me error: "Incompatible with other applications(s) using the same shared user ID". 2. So I factory reset the phone. Then I try it out, same. I can download and install YouTube, but when open it, it keeps saying same "Cannot play without Play Services". 3. Same thing happens when I install and run Google+.Installing YouTube on clean OS itself does not work.Do I need to wipe cache? I think factory resetting must also wipe cache. What should I do to resolve this issue?
